events.title: The Treaty of Nanking Signed
events.description: The Treaty of Nanking was signed, ending the First Opium War between the United Kingdom and the Qing dynasty of China. This treaty ceded Hong Kong Island to Britain and opened several Chinese ports to British trade.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of the 'Century of Humiliation' for China and significantly impacted Sino-British relations.

events.title: The Soviet Union Tests Its First Atomic Bomb
events.description: The Soviet Union successfully detonated its first atomic bomb, codenamed 'RDS-1'. This event marked the beginning of the nuclear arms race during the Cold War era.
events.significance: Ended the United States' monopoly on nuclear weapons, escalating Cold War tensions.

events.title: Death of Raymond Chandler
events.description: Raymond Chandler, an influential American novelist and screenwriter known for his contributions to the noir crime fiction genre, died.
events.significance: His work had a lasting impact on detective fiction and noir cinema.

events.title: The Warsaw Pact Officially Dissolved
events.description: The Warsaw Pact, a collective defense treaty signed by the Soviet Union and seven Eastern Bloc socialist republics during the Cold War, was formally dissolved.
events.significance: Signified the end of the Cold War military alliances and the collapse of Soviet influence in Eastern Europe.
